H0.text: Anus is the terminal opening of the complete digestive system in nematodes, which have a tubular morphology and circular cross‑section, are pseudocoelomates, and possess a distinct mouth—features that contrast with cnidarians.

H1.text: Mucus is found in nematodes, which, in contrast with cnidarians, show a tubular morphology and circular cross‑section, are pseudocoelomates, and possess a complete digestive system with a distinct mouth.

H2.text: Hairs are found on nematodes, which, unlike cnidarians, have a tubular morphology and circular cross‑section, are pseudocoelomates, and possess a complete digestive system with a distinct mouth.

H3.text: Stomach is part of the complete digestive system with a distinct mouth found in nematodes, which, unlike cnidarians, have a tubular morphology and circular cross‑section and are pseudocoelomates.

A4.text: Unlike the flatworms, nematodes have a tubular digestive system, with openings at both ends.

A5.text: No stomach is present, with the pharynx connecting directly to a muscleless intestine that forms the main length of the gut.
